verses.roman:
nāhaṁ pratīcche vai rājann
ity uktvā svāmy apākramat
nānyad gavām apy ayutam
icchāmīty aparo yayau

synonyms: na—not; aham—I; pratīcche—want; vai—indeed; rājan—O King; iti—thus; uktvā—saying; svāmī—the owner; apākramat—went away; na—not; anyat—in addition; gavām—of cows; api—even; ayutam—ten thousand; icchāmi—I want; iti—thus saying; aparaḥ—the other (brāhmaṇa); yayau—left.
translation: The present owner of the cow said, "I don't want anything in exchange for this cow, O King," and went away. The other brāhmaṇa declared, "I don't want even ten thousand more cows [than you are offering]," and he too went away.

purport.content: In Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Śrīla Prabhupāda comments, "Thus disagreeing with the King's proposal, both brāhmaṇas left the palace in anger, thinking that their lawful position had been usurped."
